txt.en: The half-orc rumoured to have been in Trestlebridge can likely be found in the Orc camp north-east of Trestlebridge.\n\nYou should search for anyone matching Aggy Digweed's description.
Aggy Digweed heard rumour of a man that was likely a half-orc slinking around Trestlebridge the night of the blast.

'The question remains as to how the suspicious powder got into town at all. We have many travellers here, being on the Greenway... and I did hear rumours of an ugly, mean-looking man that came through last night.

'I didn't see him myself, but he made a few folks uneasy. He was already gone when I went to look for him.

'Folks say he looked more than a little Orkish. Have you ever heard of such a thing?'

Lugbas is probably hiding in the far south-east corner of Nan Wathren.\n\nAggy Digweed told you of a nook in the south-east corner of Nan Wathren, atop the highest slopes, where she used to hide as a girl. She believes this is where you will most likely find Lugbas. She beseeches you to slay him before he can make more Black-fire.

'You defeated the ugly brute? Thank you, [placeholder]. We will have to be less welcoming to travellers, now, I'm afraid.\n\n'If such a man could come unhindered and wreak such havoc, then we will never be safe. Orcs creep ever closer to our gates. These are dangerous times, my friend.'
Aggy Digweed is in Trestlebridge.\n\nYou should return to Aggy Digweed with news of your victory against Lugbas.

'To end the threat of the Black-fire, Lugbas must be ended. He is likely the leader of the half-orcs.\n\n'Try searching my old hiding spot in the south-east corner of the Nan Wathren. On the highest slopes there you will find a nook. It always served me as an excellent hiding place as a girl, and Lugbas might be hiding there now!'
'With Lugbas dead, Trestlebridge is safe from the Black-fire. Thank you!'
'I shall never forget what you have done for Trestlebridge!'
Search for the half-orc who planted the powder
'May the Black-fire never blight Trestlebridge ever again!'
